Description: Senser is a distributed censorship detection and circumvention system for the web. Senser operates as a network of proxies located at different vantage points on the Internet (some of which may be subject to censorship). Clients query a random subset of Senser proxies for compact descriptions of a desired web page, and apply consensus and matching algorithms to the returned results to locally render a 'majority' web page. To ensure diverse selections of proxies (and consequently decrease an adversary's ability to censor a majority of them), Senser leverages Internet mapping systems that accurately predict AS-level paths between available proxies and the desired web page. We demonstrate using a deployment of Senser on Amazon EC2 that Senser detects and mitigates censorship attempts - even by large collections of autonomous systems - while incurring reasonable performance overheads.

Tortoise is a system for rate limiting Tor at its ingress points in order to will increase the bandwidth capacity of the network and consequently improve the experience of interactive web users. The system incurs little penalty for interactive web users, while significantly decreasing the throughput for filesharers. These techniques provide incentives to filesharers to configure their Tor clients to also relay traffic, which in turn improves the network's overall performance. Large-scale emulation results indicate that interactive users will achieve a significant speedup if even a small fraction of clients opt to run relays.
License: Released as patch to Tor; follows Tor license at https://gitweb.torproject.org/tor.git?a=blob_plain;hb=HEAD;f=LICENSE

Description: Shadow is an open source, discrete-event network simulator that runs real applications such as Tor. Shadow combines the accuracy of emulation with the efficiency and control of simulation, achieving the best of both approaches. Shadow links to real application software and natively executes the application code during simulation, providing faithful experiments and accurate results. Shadow models and runs distributed networks using these applications on a single Linux machine, easing experiment management.
License: BSD 3 clause, modified for U.S. Government work

Description: TorPS provides efficient simulation of path selection over time by Tor. For each sample, it uses measurements of the Tor network and of user behavior to simulate how a Tor client selects relays. The use of actual measurements and an accurate reimplementation of Tor's path-selection algorithms provides highly realistic behavior. Also, a TorPS simulation is much faster than the Tor client itself, which allows for millions of simulations over periods of many months, allowing for an accurate estimation of the full probability distribution of client behavior over time.
A tool to spin up a local Tor network for automated testing.
TorFlow is a set of Python scripts for interacting with and measuring the Tor network.
A software library that provides asynchronous event notification. It is the network library underlying Tor, obfsproxy, and others. We co-maintain it with Niels Provos.
Python pluggable transport library.
Go pluggable transport library.
Client and server for transporting traffic over websocket.
A framework to make it easy to write pluggable transports for Tor.
A tool that uses Websockets to turn browsers into Tor bridges.
HTTP-based pluggable transport for Tor that implements flow chop reassembly.
Service to distribute Tor bridge addresses via https, gmail, etc.
A backend database and scripts to organize and serve the Tor metrics data.
Scripts to store, serve, analyze, and visualize Tor network data.
A web application to display Tor relay information.
A web application to display Tor relay and bridge information.
A web application to display Tor relay and network statistics.
A fork of Firefox that fixes many privacy issues.
A Firefox extension to lock down Tor Browser Bundle for application-level privacy.
The older Qt-based Tor controller (obsoleted by Tor Launcher).
A Firefox extension to launch and manage Tor in Tor Browser Bundle.
A Firefox and Chrome extension that encrypts your communications with many major websites, making your browsing more secure.
An extension like Torbutton but for Thunderbird (for securing email over Tor).
A secure chat client for Android with push-to-talk Tor support.
